results.definition: uncertainty about the truth or factuality or existence of something
examples: there is no question about the validity of the enterprise

results.definition: a sentence of inquiry that asks for a reply
challenge the accuracy, probity, or propriety of
examples: We must question your judgment in this matter

results.definition: pose a series of questions to
examples: The suspect was questioned by the police
We questioned the survivor about the details of the explosion

results.definition: a formal proposal for action made to a deliberative assembly for discussion and vote
conduct an interview in television, newspaper, and radio reporting

examples: the question of disease merits serious discussion
there was a question about my training

results.definition: place in doubt or express doubtful speculation
an informal reference to a marriage proposal
examples: he was ready to pop the question
